q&a.title: Why is (NH4)2[CuCl4] square planar complex but Cs2[CuCl4] is tetrahedral?
q&a.summary: Why is $\ce{(NH4)2[CuCl4]}$ square planar complex but $\ce{Cs2[CuCl4]}$ is tetrahedral even though both have same oxidation number of copper and same ligands?

q&a.title: Use of geometry index for the determination of coordination environment
q&a.summary:
Geometry index $\tau$ is supposed to resolve proper geometry for coordination numbers (C.N.) 4 and 5 based on its extreme values ($0$ or $1$). There is also a web app Geom which handles both cases for a structure in XYZ format.
